info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Hamilton, western Fulton and southeastern Herkimer Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1245 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ohio to 9 miles east of Cold Brook to Middleville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Speculator, Dolgeville, Lake Pleasant, Wells, Stratford, Middleville, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Moffitt Beach Campground, Caroga Lake, Sacandaga Campground, Oppenheim, Fairfield, Norway, Bleecker, Hope, Arietta, Benson, Nobleboro, Curtis and Countryman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
